str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To admonish, warn, counsel, exhort. From the same as nouthesia; to put in mind, i.e. to caution or reprove gently.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: out of order), disorderly, slack (in performance of duty). Unarranged, i.e. insubordinate.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and the middle voice of a derivative of muthos; to relate near, i.e. encourage, console.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faint-hearted, of small courage. From oligos and pshar; little-spirited, i.e. Faint-hearted.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From anti and the middle voice of echo; to hold oneself opposite to, i.e. adhere to; by extension to care for.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick. Strengthless.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From the same as makrothumos; to be long-spirited, i.e. forbearing or patient.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
